result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:19 AM  Defendant Darren M Blair in court.  Attorney Abigail Broze for Peter M Wolff in court for Darren M Blair.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received discovery and is waiting for an offer.
Defense requests further proceedings date.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Warrant signed by Judge Michael Bohren cancelled on 10/10/22
Hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 10/10/2022:  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. 

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.

1:17 PM Defendant Darren M Blair in court, in custody.  Attorney Brandon Carlson for attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Darren M Blair.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Attorney Carlson states the defendant did make an appointment to with WCS but was unable to make it in time before he was arrested.  State requests the signature bond be converted to cash bail.  Response argument by Attorney Carlson to reinstate bail.  Court reinstates bail but will amend the conditions of bond in 22CF1251 that the defendant is to not be released unless during duty hours to have the GPS monitor installed with a one mile exclusion zone of Victim A/Victim B.  All other conditions to remain.

The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record Court converts the cash bond to a signature bond in 22CF1354.
Court sets signature bond in the amount of $1500.00.  All conditions to remain as previously set.
Bail in 22CF1251 to remain as previously set.
Hearing set for 10/21/22 to remain as previously set.

Defendant does not have a phone but provides his grandmother's phone number.
